transcript.content: Heroes by David Bowie on Radio 2. I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Stephen Merchant.
Hello there, um, Happy New Year.
Happy New Year indeed, and uh, uh, uh, across from us, the little fella who presses the buttons because to be honest, we can't be bothered.
How would you describe Karl Pilkington for people who didn't hear the show last week?
Um, for people who didn't hear the show, Karl is - and he won't mind me saying this, um, because he won't fully understand it -
One of the most stupid men I've ever met.
Um, he has a perfectly round head.
I mean unbelievable. You can, you can see pictures of him; go to RickyGervais.com. We've put up some um photographs, just snapshots, and honestly his head looks like an egg.
It's not an issue, though, is it?
We're on the radio. Doesn't matter.
He's just trying to get - you know, paint a picture for people, though, Karl. It's important.
In fact, I have painted a picture. You can go to the BBC website and you can, uh, I think you can win that. If someone hasn't already.
I think you can also, can you download it as wallpaper for your, uh, for your computer? You can. So if you want to see a cartoon representation of Karl, then there it is.
It's an original signed by me. I'm, it's not a Damien Hirst.
But it, I mean I think it's pretty accurate, Steve. You d- I mean, for people who can't see him. You can see a few - a real photo or the - that's uh Karl Pilkinton, one of the most stupid men alive.
You know, some people still think that he's an invention.
He think - they thought that, that, that we invented him and we give him lines and stuff. As if we could do that. What, have we shaved his head as well?
And made him live in Manchester for 20 years? It's...
For people who've not experienced Karl before, they'll hopefully there'll be plenty of Karl later in the show.
Well, actually, um, we've got Karl doing a sermon.
For, um, the Church of England. It's be been requested, um, by the, the, the Church of England, which is unbelievable.

And I actually went and bought him a little Bible, right? He didn't have a Bible. I- he said, "The Bible's too heavy, it's got no pictures." So I bought him a children's Bible which is embarrassing, asking for that in Waterstones.
For a start. And um, even that was too much for him. He was going, "There's two hundred pages." I mean the writing, the letters, the font, was about, I'd say, half a centimetre high, right?
And, uh, uh, but, you've, you've read it, have you?
I haven't read all of it. I just caught some of the highlights.
Give it me the other day!
So we're doing the history of religion, are we? Um, coming up.
Well - ugh. What do you mean, what do I mean?
No, I'm just doing a little taster. What... the problem was, right, last week-
What do you mean, a little taster? What, like, what, wha-
Are we trying to sell Bibles-
It's the biggest sellling book in the world. They don't need it. I thought you were gonna do a message a, a New Year's message.
No, but it's kind of been forgotten about a little bit innnit?
Because of Harry Potter and stuff like that.
Yeah you see the Bible these days, and goes, "What's that? What do you mean, the Bible?"
No, but I'm just saying, there's probably a, you know, a lot of people out there, who've go- sort of gone, "Ah, you know, it's an old book.
And once something's been around for a bit, you've br- you don't sort of visit it. It's like, uh-
Sorry, this isn't Harry Potter we're talking about. This is the Bible.
But there's films out, do you know what I mean-
There's films that have been and gone and its like oh, no-one's talking about it any more, I won't bother.
So, you're, you're giving the Ch-, you're giving the Church of England a little bit of a boost?
Well, you're laughing but it is Christmas.
Now last week - can I just ask - last week, um, on the show, we were uh, talking about the gift that you'd arranged to, uh, for your girlfriend. Now-
How long have you been going out with her again?
Um... pft... think it's about eleven years.

Partner. He got her, um, a a gift when he left, um, his old job, of a camera. He didn't even unwrap it. He just passed it on straight away. Like pass the parcel to his girlfriend. We were giving him some stick. Um everyone - about 90% of people phoning in saying you are a skinflint. It's awful. How did, how did it go down?
Did she, did she love it?
Yes, I - I think she liked it, yeah.
I mean she, she didn't really have a go on it. I was playing about with it on Christmas Day.
Showing her how to use it and that. And said, you know. She's, she's paid
For a holiday for us to go away. I said take it on that, use it. She's loving it.
Did you tell her before you gave it to her that you'd got it as a, as a leaving gift for your previous job?
Yeah, just before. I mean I wasn't going to but because of last Saturday, you sort of put a bit of pressure on-
-I went off and bought her a watch.
But I thought a little extra- extra present.
One of those ones with a little calculator on? From, from a Texaco?
Uh. No, it's alright. It's like a little square art deco, the fella said it was.
It is nice. I've seen it.
Yeah yeah yeah, no, it's, it is uh -
And how did you tell her? When you, when you came in with the big news?
That you hadn't bought the gift.
I just sort of said, "Oh, you said you wanted a camera, didn't you
Well here's one I got from work. And, uh, anyway, here's another one."
So I just sort of told her-
And also, uh, you, you gave us the-
-devastating news last week that just before Christmas, your mum's budgie died. How was Christmas in your household? Was it-
Um... a little bit down. A little bit down. You know, with, with any death... it's always sad, innit. No matter what it is.
Well, I mean, how long she had it? Probably lasted about eight years or something, which is pretty good, innit, for a budgie?
Um, came unexpected. Wasn't ill. Um...
And uh, what she, what, uh, I spoke to her the other day and I said, you know, how's it going? Because on Christmas Day she was down.

Been calling her up every day. And I spoke to her the other day and said, you know, how're things? And she said uh, said well the other bird that's in the cage - she's got uh, a sort of parrot that's in the same cage as it-
It's missing its mate. So what she did, she'd kept a few feathers from the budgeie that died, right. She got a rock, a couple
Of, uh, sandwich fasteners, and stuck the feathers on the rock. The other bird's happy now.
Now I know that... your mother explains everything.
And if you ever die, we'll just get a tennis ball, stick it on the end of a broom. She'll be happy.
Handbags and Gladrags, by Rod Stewart. That'd make a good theme tune.
And then it would work really well, perhaps on a DVD.
Still be available in the shops. Great for any, um, you know, new year's vouchers you've got.
You're listening to Ricky Gervais on Radio 2 with Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington. So good Christmasses, yeah, all round?
Definitely for me. I had a great time. Yeah. Karl?
With, uh, what did Suzanne get you?
Um... she got me, uh- you see, you were having a go at me about giving her, uh, a camera, right? Which, which I think was-
Doesn't, don't, don't really matter, that bit. But it's a present that both of us could use, right?
And you were making me feel bad about that. And that's why I got her a watch.
Right. Which in a way I can use because I can say, "What time is it?"
But the thing is, right? She got me, a uh-
She got me a, a little printer.
You mean a little fellow who works in a print shop?
Just a little printer to go with a computer and that. But for me, again, that's a present that, you know, we can all be using.
If you - it's only like reading a book when you're on a train, innit?
What are you talking about? These films cost millions of dollars. They're-everything's, everything's perfect, and they-
And the music, the sound effects-
The, the, the, the whole montage. The, this mixed medium- And someone comes along and goes, "Oh, I might as well talk to Gavin on my phone. We're reading it anyway." You're an idiot.
You're an idiot, Karl. I think your New Year's resolution should be less stupid.
Nah, nah, I'm doing, uh - I'm going to try and learn something new every day
Uh, well I did a lot yesterday so I'm having a day off today.
But, but, no, you know, just, uh, well, I did, didn't I? I did the, the, the Bible stuff and that. So, uh, I'm gonna...
Oh, yeah. We got that coming up. Karl's sermon.
What's your New Year resolution? To be less annoyed?
I suppose I should be more tolerant of others.
And do you know what Ricky said his is going to be?
Yeah, well, I just thought, I just thought-
But this is the wonderful hypocrisy of it, because you, you've just been agreeing with me about how you hate people who are annoying. You-
But only to friends! People like - the thing is right, I've gotta, I've got to say a couple of things, right.
The reason I sort of torture Karl is because I-it-I don't know. My friends - I, I, I've got friends with defects.
I don't know what... I, all my friends are slightly weird, or stupid, or something wrong with them. Karl's little round head. Uh, ju-ju-I mean, the brain of a fish.
Right? I can't keep my hands off his head. Um, Robin Ince. He's got glasses, he waddles funny, he's got little thumbs there - his thumbs are too short, right?
I can't keep my hands off him, right? My mate, um, Rob, um, who did Flanimals with me, he's got a perfectly round head.
He is in America, though, for when you need a little round bald head, in' he? Just in case you're-
Yeah, exactly! For when I go to New York or- And he looks a bit like Dave Hill from Slade.
Interesting that you're collaborating on a book but he chooses to live in America.

I know, yeah! But um, could I just say also that I do not advocate the use of vices on friends' heads. It's dangerous, do not, do not, um, squeeze your mate's head in a vice. That's just between me and Karl and you know and, but-
Ricky Gervais is an experienced annoyer.
And he probably wouldn't let me do it, to be honest. I'd have to offer him an awful lot of money. Also, do not smoke. There's no point.
And floss. I wish I'd flossed when I was a kid. Also, if you've got a bicycle or anything like that for Christmas, please wear the correct safety gear.
Well, whoa. Whoa whoa whoa whoa.
Well, I got a bike as a kid.
Right. And my dad, uh, you know, he'd - I think, I think the helmets used to come, come with them, and what 'ave you. I popped it on, went out on me bike. Coming back into the garden.
Dad sees me. He says, "Come here." I said, "What?" He said, "I never want to see you wearing that helmet again. You look ridiculous."
Oh! He'd rather take the risk!
No-one looks good in them though, do they?
I d- Yes,  they do. Wear the helmet.
Neil Young and Heart of Gold on uh, BBC Radio 2 with me, Ricky Gervais, Steve Merchant-

We were asking for the worst Christmas gifts you've ever received, uh, past or present, and uh, there have been some absolute stinkers here. Pete Archer says, "I'm diabetic and I once got three big tins of sweets."
I mean, that's just rubbing it in. Cesca says, uh, "I once got a Christmas tree from my brother. On Christmas Day."

I got an invite, um, for the palace, I won't be able to attend. I said, I thought it was a little bit harsh to just send back "I will not be attending." He said, "How delightfully polite of you to call."
I don't know! But I went, "That's no worries," and he said, "Oh that's no trouble, thank you so much for calling." I bet no-one calls him.

I bet he doesn't get a look in and it was really- I was so glad I called and didn't just send back "I will not be attending." But listen, keep inviting me, 'cause I mean if it's right for my diary, I'd love to come along and have a mooch around. Seriously.
Yeah, see what's going on up there.
Yeah. So uh - Salman Rushdie, right, this is a, a funny story, so, I've met him a few times now.
I bet his house is a mess.
Right. Um, uh, it was just after the, the first, um, series of The Office went out. I got invited to this, um, uh, thing, uh, uh, I'd met Jonathan, actually. I'd met Jonathan Ross on this-

-on this show. And um, uh, we were talking about being Bowie fans. I'd never met him before. And he said, "Well I'm interviewing Bowie for this special, come along." And I went along, and there was Bowie, my hero. It was amazing. A couple of big celebrities in the audience, one of them was just Salman Rushdie, and uh, Greg Dyke

Who was, uh, head of BBC then, said to me, said, "I'm a Bowie fan, do you wanna go and meet him?" and I went, "Uh, okay." All right. So we went down. So it's me, Greg Dyke, right, and Salman Rushdie, going, "I'm chatting to Bowie." I went to the pub the next day, with my mate, and he said, "What did you do last night?"
And I said, "Nothing." Because I couldn't say, "I was hanging out with David Bowie, Greg Dyke and Salman Rushdie. Why? What did you do?"
If uh, you can name every, uh, celebrity that Ricky has mentioned in the last link...
Uh, who he spent time with, then you can win yourself a prize. Um, perhaps a signed copy of, uh, Extras. Um, for which he got invited to the palace and I didn't.
Uh, 882921 if you can name every name that Ricky Gervais dropped.
Rick, as you know, I absolutely love a good cover version. I think that a cover version, if it's done really well, can not only match the original, it can sometimes even better it.

And I think that, that's Ryan Adams' version of Wonderwall. And I think, you know, much as I love Wonderwall, it almost reinvests it with a new beauty, and a new majesty that perhaps we've forgotten about because the other song is so overplayed.
No taking it away from Noel.
It's almost kind of reinvented it.
It's beautiful. Absolutely beautiful. Great song anyway.
And that's what's weird, really, 'cause you've done that and that's kind of what I've done.
Well, you've taken Blockbusters and changed one word.
Karl makes a noise of disagreement
Because those are real clues that work.
Karl makes another noise of disgreement
Yours are the ramblings of a madman.
You don't really understand what the word cryptic means-
-it's more - this should be called, what am I thinking?

We should just introduce the idea of Rockbusters to people who didn't hear it last week. Um, now I'm trying to think of some classic ones. Do you remember there was the now, what was it, the, the, the, the West-
Jamaican fella spinning, sprin, uh, spinning a, um, a fish round his head.
And he tried to make it sound-I mean, it doesn't work.
You have to speak in a Jamaican accent.
Well, they wouldn't, they wouldn't say De Trout.
So it doesn't work there. So that's the stupid 'Wet Knee Houston'.
No one called Wet Knee Houston.
So you need to basically crawl inside Karl's head and figure out what's going on in there if you want to win these. We've got some Kylie collectibles for Rockbusters.
The good thing about crawling into Karl's head is there is a  lot of room.
It's very much like when God created the Earth. You can just fill it up with any
Was it? Ugh... Shall we have some real news?
I-I'm just...I'm dumbfounded by that monkey news.
Okay, well I'll I'll I'll- I'm going to give it a full assessment.
Let's see if-there's the news coming up. See if there's any stories like that in this. Right. On 88 to 91 FM. This is Radio 2 from the BBC.

synopsis.description: Ricky describes Karl for new listeners
Karl will be giving a sermon to revive the forgotten religion of Christianity
Karl gave Suzanne a second-hand camera for Christmas
